service_offerings.name: xsuaa
service_offerings.description: Manage application authorizations and trust to identity providers.

metadata.longDescription: Configure trust to identity providers for authentication. Manage your authorization model consisting of roles, groups and role collections, and assigning them to users. Use RESTful APIs to automate and integrate with other systems.

service_offerings.name: hana
service_offerings.description: Manage schemas and HDI containers on an existing SAP HANA database.

metadata.longDescription:
Use the "SAP HANA Schemas & HDI Containers" service to create service instances on SAP HANA databases and bind them to cloud applications. To create schemas and HDI containers, an SAP HANA database must be available in your space.

The "SAP HANA Schemas & HDI Containers" service works with SAP HANA databases provided by the SAP HANA service or SAP HANA Cloud.

service_offerings.name: application-logs
service_offerings.description: Create, store, access, and analyze application logs.

metadata.longDescription: Stream logs of bound applications to a central application logging stack that uses OpenSearch to store and visualize the application log data. To fully leverage this service, please also consider using one of SAP's open source libraries (e.g. cf-java-logging-support or cf-nodejs-logging-support). You can analyze your logs at https://logs.cf.sap.hana.ondemand.com

service_offerings.name: feature-flags
service_offerings.description: Feature Flags service for controlling feature rollout

metadata.longDescription: Feature Flags service allows you to enable or disable new features at application runtime, based on predefined rules or release plan schedule.

service_offerings.name: autoscaler
service_offerings.description: Automatically increase or decrease the number of application instances based on a policy you define.

service_offerings.name: connectivity
service_offerings.description: Establishes a secure and reliable connectivity between cloud applications and on-premise systems.

metadata.longDescription: Use the Connectivity service to establish secure and reliable connectivity between your cloud applications and on-premise systems running in isolated networks.

service_offerings.name: auditlog
service_offerings.description: Broker for Audit Log Service in CF

metadata.longDescription: The Audit Log Service Broker is the component that enables auditlogging in a given scenario. Use it by creating a service instance and either bind it to a CF application that will write auditlogs, or create a service-key for non-CF scenarios. Based on the service plan, the created service binding or service-key provide the required credentials to write auditlogs via the Audit Log REST API or one of the Audit Log Clients. We currently offer three service plans for the Audit Log Service Broker: 'oauth2' plan is secure and reliable and is the recommended plan for writing audit logs as an internal service; 'standard' plan is also available for internal services, but will soon be deprecated and is left to enable migration towards the 'oauth2' plan; 'premium' provides the same level of security as the 'oauth2' plan, but is aimed at applications developed for external customers.

service_offerings.name: destination
service_offerings.description: Provides a secure and reliable access to destination and certificate configurations

metadata.longDescription: Use the Destination service to provide your cloud applications with access to destination and certificate configurations in a secure and reliable way

service_offerings.name: saas-registry
service_offerings.description: Service for application providers to register multitenant applications and services

service_offerings.name: html5-apps-repo
service_offerings.description: Enables storage of HTML5 applications and provides runtime environment for HTML5 applications.

metadata.longDescription: The HTML5 Application Repository service enables central storage of HTML5 applications in SAP BTP. In runtime, the service enables the consuming application, typically the application router, to access HTML5 application static content in a secure and efficient manner.

service_offerings.name: business-logging
service_offerings.description: Log your cloud application flow from a business perspective.

service_offerings.name: credstore
service_offerings.description: Secure repository for credentials, cryptographic keys and certificates.

metadata.longDescription: Provides a secure repository for passwords and keys to the applications running on the SAP Cloud Platform, enabling the applications to retrieve them easily and use them for authentication to external services or for performing various cryptographic operations such as signing and verifying of digital signatures, encrypting of and decrypting of messages, and for performing TLS communication. The Credential Store service is exposed to applications via a RESTful API.

service_offerings.name: ui5-flexibility-design-and-configuration
service_offerings.description: UI5 Flexibility Design and Configuration

metadata.displayName: UI5 Flexibility Design and Configuration Service

service_offerings.name: portal
service_offerings.description: Create SAP Fiori launchpad sites for employees, customers, and partners.

metadata.longDescription: Easily create SAP Fiori launchpad sites for employees, customers, and partners

service_offerings.name: auditlog-api
service_offerings.description: [DEPRECATED] Auditlog API

service_offerings.name: malware-scanner
service_offerings.description: Scan single files for threats, via HTTP

metadata.longDescription: Scan Business documents for viruses.

service_offerings.name: theming
service_offerings.description: Provides theming infrastructure.

metadata.longDescription: Provides theming infrastructure, including repository and UI Theme Designer

service_offerings.name: ui5-flexibility-personalization
service_offerings.description: UI5 Flexibility Personalization Service

service_offerings.name: certificate-service
service_offerings.description: Get client certificates from SAP Cloud certification authorities.

metadata.longDescription: Get client certificates from SAP Cloud certification authorities. The REST API allows an agile PKI integration into your Cloud application without being responsible for the concrete provider APIs.

service_offerings.name: auditlog-management
service_offerings.description: Retrieve logs and change retention

metadata.longDescription: Retrieve audit logs

service_offerings.name: metering-service
service_offerings.description: Record usage data for commercial purposes like billing, charging, and resource planning.

service_offerings.name: INFRA
service_offerings.description: Configure and expose your application under your own domain.

metadata.longDescription: The Custom Domain service gives the user the possibility of using their own domains instead of the default Cloud Platform domains for their applications as well as choosing their own certificates to protect their applications.

service_offerings.name: Excise-Tax-Service
service_offerings.description: This service exposes different plans to be consumed by the customers of Excise Tax

service_offerings.name: print
service_offerings.description: Manage print queues, connect print clients and monitor print status

metadata.longDescription: Manage print queues, connect print clients and monitor print status

service_offerings.name: lps-service
service_offerings.description: Service for integrating with LPS Service

service_offerings.name: sap-analytics-cloud-embedded-edition
service_offerings.description: Analyze data via live connection to your business applications SAP HANA database.

metadata.longDescription: Analyze data via live connection to your business application's SAP HANA database.

service_offerings.name: hana-cloud
service_offerings.description: Leverage the in-memory data processing capabilities of SAP HANA in the cloud as one simple gateway to all data.

metadata.longDescription: SAP HANA Cloud allows you to leverage the in-memory data processing capabilities of SAP HANA in the cloud. As a managed database service, backups are fully automated and service availability guaranteed. Using SAP HANA Cloud, you can set up and manage SAP HANA databases and bind them to applications running on SAP Business Technology Platform. You can access SAP HANA databases using a variety of languages and interfaces, as well as build applications and models using tools provided with SAP HANA. Furthermore, SAP HANA Cloud helps you to manage where and how data is stored and accessed, depending on performance needs.

service_offerings.name: ui5-flexibility-keyuser
service_offerings.description: Add UI adaptation to your UI5 applications.

metadata.longDescription: The UI5 flexibility service for key users lets you provide UI adaptation capabilites for your UI5 applications on Cloud Foundry. Users of your applications can change the user interface of your applications in an upgrade-safe and modification-free way, without affecting any other customer.

service_offerings.name: service-manager
service_offerings.description: The central registry for service brokers and platforms in SAP Business Technology Platform

metadata.longDescription: SAP Service Manager allows you to consume platform services in any connected runtime environment, track service instances creation, and share services and service instances between different environments.

service_offerings.name: subscription-manager
service_offerings.description: Service to manage multitenant applications and services.

service_offerings.name: devhubservice
service_offerings.description: Expose your data and processes as APIs for omni-channel consumption and manage the lifecycle of those APIs.

metadata.longDescription: Drives innovation in modern business models. Based on APIs and digital assets, this solution facilitates unified access from new channels and diverse user interfaces by enabling developer communities to connect to your enterprise information and processes securely. Access to back-end services and complex landscapes are simplified with easy to consume APIs while protecting your systems from threats and overloaded access.

resources.name: standard
resources.description: Standard PostgreSQL service offering

metadata.longDescription: Create production-ready PostgreSQL instances

audit_log_level.description: Defines which classes of statements will be logged by session audit logging

memory.description: Defines amount of memory (in GB) to be used for the instance. The number of CPU cores is also derived from the value based on the standard plan's semantics

storage.description: Amount of storage in GB to be allocated to the instance

engine_version.description: The major version of the PostgreSQL database to use. If not provided, the major version is defaulted to 16

locale.description: Indicates the locale for the instance (TODO)

multi_az.description: Indicates whether the instance is a multi-AZ deployment. If not provided, it is defaulted to true. For a multi-AZ instance, twice the number of storage SKU units are deducted from available entitlements

maintenance_window.description: Indicates the preferred maintenance window for the PostgreSQL database instance. The 30-minute maintenance window is selected at random from the specified block of time.

day_of_week.description: Day of the week when the PostgreSQL database instance can be patched.

start_hour_utc.description: Start hour of the time block (in UTC).

duration.description: Duration of the time block in hours.

public_access.description: Indicates whether the instance is publicly accessible. If not provided, it is defaulted to false.

allow_access.description: Comma separated list of IPs and CF landscape domains from which connectivity to the instance can be established. Default behaviour will be to block all access to the instance from any public IP except CF Domain of instance's landscape.

backup_retention_period.description: Defines backup retention period for the PostgreSQL database instance

cross_region_backup.description: Indicates whether cross region backup is enabled for that instance. If not provided, it is defaulted to true.

ignore_default_ips.description: Indicates whether default NAT IPs should be ignored.

audit_log_level.description: Defines which classes of statements will be logged by session audit logging

memory.description: Defines amount of memory (in GB) to be used for the instance. The number of CPU cores is also derived from the value based on the standard plan's semantics. Note that memory cannot be downscaled

storage.description: Amount of storage in GB to be allocated to the instance. Note that storage cannot be downscaled.

engine_version.description: The major version of the PostgreSQL database to use. If not provided, the existing engine version is not changed.

multi_az.description: Indicates whether the instance is a multi-AZ deployment. If not provided, the existing configuration is not changed.

maintenance_window.description: Indicates the preferred maintenance window for the PostgreSQL database instance. The 30-minute maintenance window is selected at random from the specified block of time.

day_of_week.description: Day of the week when the PostgreSQL database instance can be patched.

start_hour_utc.description: Start hour of the time block (in UTC).

duration.description: Duration of the time block in hours.

allow_access.description: Comma separated list of IPs and CF landscape domains from which connectivity to the instance can be established. It will overide the access list provided during previous create/update operation

backup_retention_period.description: Defines backup retention period for the PostgreSQL database instance

cross_region_backup.description: Indicates whether cross region backup is enabled for that instance. If not provided, it is defaulted to false.

ignore_default_ips.description: Indicates whether default NAT IPs should be ignored.

enable_cmk.description: Enables CMK features on a particular PostgreSQL Instance

show_cert_url.description: Adds server and client certificate urls in the VCAP credentials

resources.name: development
resources.description: Redis Cache service offering for development purposes

metadata.longDescription: Create Redis Cache instances for use in development pipelines

engine_version.description: The major version number of the cache engine to be used for the clusters. If not provided, the major version is defaulted to 6.0

eviction_policy.description: The eviction policy for keys when maximum memory usage is reached. Default is 'noeviction'

notify_keyspace_events.description: Indicates the keyspace events for which notifications are enabled. If not provided, notifications are disabled.

engine_version.description: The major version number of the cache engine to be used for the clusters. If not provided, the existing engine version is not changed.

eviction_policy.description: The eviction policy for keys when maximum memory usage is reached. Default is 'noeviction'

notify_keyspace_events.description: Indicates the keyspace events for which notifications are enabled. If not provided, notifications are disabled.

resources.name: standard
resources.description: Standard Redis Cache service offering

metadata.longDescription: Create production-ready Redis Cache instances

cluster_mode.description: Indicates whether the instance is clustered redis deployment. If not provided, it is defaulted to true.

engine_version.description: The major version number of the cache engine to be used for the clusters. If not provided, the major version is defaulted to 6.0

eviction_policy.description: The eviction policy for keys when maximum memory usage is reached. Default is 'noeviction'

maintenance_window.description: Indicates the maintenance window for the Redis cache.

day_of_week.description: Day of the week when Redis cache instance can be patched.

start_hour_utc.description: Start hour after which patching of the Redis cache instance can start.

duration.description: Number of hours required for patching the Redis cache instance.

memory.description: Defines amount of memory (in GB) to be used for the instance. The number of CPU cores is also derived from the value based on the standard plan's semantics

multi_az.description: Indicates whether the instance is a multi-AZ deployment. If not provided, it is defaulted to true.

node_count.description: Indicates the number of nodes per shard within the Redis cluster. If not provided, it is defaulted to 3. For instances with multiple shards and nodes per shard, the number of storage SKU units deducted from available entitlements is equal to the total nodes count in the cluster.

notify_keyspace_events.description: Indicates the keyspace events for which notifications are enabled. If not provided, notifications are disabled.

shard_count.description: Indicates the number of shards within the Redis cluster. If not provided, it is defaulted to 1. For instances with multiple shards and nodes per shard, the number of storage SKU units deducted from available entitlements is equal to the total nodes count in the cluster.

engine_version.description: The major version number of the cache engine to be used for the clusters. If not provided, the existing engine version is not changed.

eviction_policy.description: The eviction policy for keys when maximum memory usage is reached. Default is 'noeviction'

maintenance_window.description: Indicates the maintenance window for the Redis cache.

day_of_week.description: Day of the week when Redis cache instance can be patched.

start_hour_utc.description: Start hour after which patching of the Redis cache instance can start.

duration.description: Number of hours required for patching the Redis cache instance.

memory.description: Defines amount of memory (in GB) to be used for the instance. The number of CPU cores is also derived from the value based on the standard plan's semantics

multi_az.description: Indicates whether the instance is a multi-AZ deployment. Only non-multi-AZ to multi-AZ is allowed.

node_count.description: Indicates the number of nodes per shard within the Redis cluster. If not provided, it is defaulted to 3. For instances with multiple shards and nodes per shard, the number of storage SKU units deducted from available entitlements is equal to the total nodes count in the cluster.

notify_keyspace_events.description: Indicates the keyspace events for which notifications are enabled. If not provided, notifications are disabled.

shard_count.description: Indicates the number of shards within the Redis cluster. If not provided, it is defaulted to 1. For instances with multiple shards and nodes per shard, the number of storage SKU units deducted from available entitlements is equal to the total nodes count in the cluster.

resources.name: tenant
resources.description: SAP Data Intelligence - Tenant plan

bullets: Add new isolated tenants to a running Data Intelligence instance on the same subaccount. New tenants will share the same hardware resources as their parent clusters (enterprise plan or dedicated plan)

clusterName.description: Name of the existing cluster where the new tenant will be created

adminUsername.description: Admin username of the new tenant

adminPassword.description: Admin password of the new tenant

resourceQuotas.description: resource quotas for the new tenant
resource quotas for the new tenant

resources.name: shared-postgresql
resources.description: [RESTRICTED USAGE] PostgreSQL database on a shared dedicated instance

metadata.longDescription: Create PostgreSQL database instances on a shared dedicated instance

dedicated_instance_id.description: GUID of the dedicated instance. The logical database would be created in this already created dedicated PostgreSQL instance

connection_limit.description: Maximum number of connections allowed for the SQL database

dedicated_instance.description: Name of the dedicated instance. The logical database would be created in this already created dedicated PostgreSQL instance

source_tenant_instance_id.description: GUID of the source tenant instance. A reference logical database would be created for a source tenant instance

connection_limit.description: Maximum number of connections allowed for the SQL database

show_cert_url.description: Adds server and client certificate urls in the VCAP credentials

resources.name: environment
resources.description: Create a Dynatrace environment and monitor your cloud applications and services.

environment_name.description: Name for the environment, maximum 16 uppercase letters and numbers.

quotas.description: Provide quota settings for the Dynatrace environment (optional).

ddu_serverless.description: Provide quota settings for Davis Data Units of type Serverless (optional). DDU Serverless are required for monitoring serverless compute technologies.

monthly_limit.description: Provide limit for monthly DDU Serverless quota. Set to '-1' for unlimited quota. Omitting this field or sending it with 'null' value keeps the current value. Default: 20000

ddu_traces.description: Provide quota settings for Davis Data Units of type Traces (optional). DDU Traces are required when OpenTelemetry Traces are ingested from hosts where no Dynatrace agent is running.

monthly_limit.description: Provide limit for monthly DDU Traces quota. Set to '-1' for unlimited quota. Omitting this field or sending it with 'null' value keeps the current value. Default: 40000

dem_units.description: Provide quota settings for DEM Units (optional). DEM Units are required for Synthetic Monitoring and Real User Monitoring.

annual_limit.description: Provide limit for annual DEM Units quota. Set to '-1' for unlimited quota. Must be set together with 'monthly_limit'. Omitting this field or sending it with 'null' value keeps the current value. Default: 0

monthly_limit.description: Provide limit for monthly DEM Units quota. Set to '-1' for unlimited quota. Must be set together with 'annual_limit'. Omitting this field or sending it with 'null' value keeps the current value. Default: 0

host_units.description: Provide quota settings for Host Units (optional).

limit.description: Provide limit for Host Units quota. Set to '-1' for unlimited quota. Omitting this field or sending it with 'null' value keeps the current value. Default: unlimited

synthetic_monitors.description: Provide quota settings for Synthetic Monitors (optional). Synthetic Monitors will consume DEM Units.

annual_limit.description: Provide limit for annual Synthetic Monitors quota. Set to '-1' for unlimited quota. Must be set together with 'monthly_limit'. Omitting this field or sending it with 'null' value keeps the current value. Default: 0

monthly_limit.description: Provide limit for monthly Synthetic Monitors quota. Set to '-1' for unlimited quota. Must be set together with 'annual_limit'. Omitting this field or sending it with 'null' value keeps the current value. Default: 0

user_sessions.description: Provide quota settings for User Sessions (RUM) (optional). User Sessions will consume DEM Units.

annual_limit.description: Provide limit for annual User Sessions quota. Set to '-1' for unlimited quota. Must be set together with 'monthly_limit'. Omitting this field or sending it with 'null' value keeps the current value. Default: 0

monthly_limit.description: Provide limit for monthly User Sessions quota. Set to '-1' for unlimited quota. Must be set together with 'annual_limit'. Omitting this field or sending it with 'null' value keeps the current value. Default: 0

roles.description: Manage the authorizations for your environment by assigning CAM Profiles to different roles.

admin.description: Role authorization: Access the environment and manage all settings.

cam_profiles.description: Enter one or multiple CAM Profile(s) that should grant the "Admin" authorizations.

users.description: Enter one or multiple SAP E-Mail addresses that should be granted the "Admin" authorizations.

alerting_manager.description: Role authorization: Access the environment and manage anomaly detection, alerting profiles, and notification-related settings.

cam_profiles.description: Enter one or multiple CAM Profile(s) that should grant the "Alerting Manager" authorizations.

users.description: Enter one or multiple SAP E-Mail addresses that should be granted the "Alerting Manager" authorizations.

operator.description: Role authorization: Access the environment and manage all settings except for sensitive data settings.

cam_profiles.description: Enter one or multiple CAM Profile(s) that should grant the "Operator" authorizations.

users.description: Enter one or multiple SAP E-Mail addresses that should be granted the "Operator"  authorizations.

sensitive_data_manager.description: Role authorization: Access the environment and manage sensitive data-related settings.

cam_profiles.description: Enter one or multiple CAM Profile(s) that should grant the "Sensitive Data Manager" authorizations.

users.description: Enter one or multiple SAP E-Mail addresses that should be granted the "Sensitive Data Manager" authorizations.

user.description: Role authorization: Access the environment and view settings.

cam_profiles.description: Enter one or multiple CAM Profile(s) that should grant the "Viewer" authorizations.

users.description: Enter one or multiple SAP E-Mail addresses that should be granted the "Viewer" authorizations.

cam_profiles.description: Enter one or multiple CAM Profile(s) that should grant the "Viewer" authorizations.

users.description: Enter one or multiple SAP E-Mail addresses that should be granted the "Viewer" authorizations.

service_parameters.description: All parameters configured here will be provided to bound apps.

skiperrors.description: If set to true, the binding of this service instance does not fail when technical errors occur. This flag configures Cloud Foundry buildpack to continue staging even if the download of the Dynatrace agent failed.

tags.description: Add tags to your environment. The tags can either be a key-value pair or just a key. If a value is provided, it must be separated from the key by '='. The value delimiter is '='; examples: "key=value" or "key". The value is optional.

environment_name.description: Name for the environment, maximum 16 uppercase letters and numbers.

quotas.description: Provide quota settings for the Dynatrace environment (optional).

ddu_serverless.description: Provide quota settings for Davis Data Units of type Serverless (optional). DDU Serverless are required for monitoring serverless compute technologies.

monthly_limit.description: Provide limit for monthly DDU Serverless quota. Set to '-1' for unlimited quota. Omitting this field or sending it with 'null' value keeps the current value. Default: 20000

ddu_traces.description: Provide quota settings for Davis Data Units of type Traces (optional). DDU Traces are required when OpenTelemetry Traces are ingested from hosts where no Dynatrace agent is running.

monthly_limit.description: Provide limit for monthly DDU Traces quota. Set to '-1' for unlimited quota. Omitting this field or sending it with 'null' value keeps the current value. Default: 40000

dem_units.description: Provide quota settings for DEM Units (optional). DEM Units are required for Synthetic Monitoring and Real User Monitoring.

annual_limit.description: Provide limit for annual DEM Units quota. Set to '-1' for unlimited quota. Must be set together with 'monthly_limit'. Omitting this field or sending it with 'null' value keeps the current value. Default: 0

monthly_limit.description: Provide limit for monthly DEM Units quota. Set to '-1' for unlimited quota. Must be set together with 'annual_limit'. Omitting this field or sending it with 'null' value keeps the current value. Default: 0

host_units.description: Provide quota settings for Host Units (optional).

limit.description: Provide limit for Host Units quota. Set to '-1' for unlimited quota. Omitting this field or sending it with 'null' value keeps the current value. Default: unlimited

synthetic_monitors.description: Provide quota settings for Synthetic Monitors (optional). Synthetic Monitors will consume DEM Units.

annual_limit.description: Provide limit for annual Synthetic Monitors quota. Set to '-1' for unlimited quota. Must be set together with 'monthly_limit'. Omitting this field or sending it with 'null' value keeps the current value. Default: 0

monthly_limit.description: Provide limit for monthly Synthetic Monitors quota. Set to '-1' for unlimited quota. Must be set together with 'annual_limit'. Omitting this field or sending it with 'null' value keeps the current value. Default: 0

user_sessions.description: Provide quota settings for User Sessions (RUM) (optional). User Sessions will consume DEM Units.

annual_limit.description: Provide limit for annual User Sessions quota. Set to '-1' for unlimited quota. Must be set together with 'monthly_limit'. Omitting this field or sending it with 'null' value keeps the current value. Default: 0

monthly_limit.description: Provide limit for monthly User Sessions quota. Set to '-1' for unlimited quota. Must be set together with 'annual_limit'. Omitting this field or sending it with 'null' value keeps the current value. Default: 0

service_parameters.description: All parameters configured here will be provided to bound apps.

skiperrors.description: If set to true, the binding of this service instance does not fail when technical errors occur. This flag configures Cloud Foundry buildpack to continue staging even if the download of the Dynatrace agent failed.

tags.description: Add tags to your environment. The tags can either be a key-value pair or just a key. If a value is provided, it must be separated from the key by '='. The value delimiter is '='; examples: "key=value" or "key". The value is optional.

rest_apitoken.description: Token for the Dynatrace REST API which should be created with the listed scopes

scopes.description: Define which of the scopes you want to assign to the REST API token

skiperrors.description: Ensure binding does not fail when technical errors occur and configure the buildpack to continue staging even if the download of the Dynatrace agent failed

token_expiresin.description: Expiry duration for all tokens. Default value: 1y. Max value: 3y. Possible values (not combinable): [1-3]y; [1-11]M; [1-51]w; [1-30]d; [1-23]h; [1-59]m.

tokens.description: Dynatrace access token that should be created with the listed scopes and will be exposed under the specified name

name.description: Name under which the token will be accessible in the binding credentials

scopes.description: Define which of the scopes you want to assign to the token

resources.name: reference-instance
resources.description: Allows to create a reference to a shared service instance from any environment in a subaccount and manage service bindings to that service instance.

referenced_instance_id.title: Shared Instance ID
referenced_instance_id.description: Specify the ID of the instance to which you want to create the reference.

selectors.title: Find by
selectors.description: You can create a reference to a shared service instance without providing its ID. Use instead various attributes, such as plan, instance name, or labels to find a matching shared instance to which to create the reference.

instance_name_selector.title: Instance Name
instance_name_selector.description: Specify the instance name of the shared instance to which you want to create the reference.

plan_name_selector.title: Plan Name
plan_name_selector.description: Specify the plan name of the shared instance to which you want to create the reference.

instance_label_selector.title: Labels
instance_label_selector.description: Use label query to find the shared instance to which you want to create the reference. For example: origin eq eu returns an instance whose origin is in the EU. You can add multiple label queries to a single search.

service_offerings.name: hana
service_offerings.description: Manage schemas and HDI containers on an existing SAP HANA database.

metadata.longDescription:
Use the "SAP HANA Schemas & HDI Containers" service to create service instances on SAP HANA databases and bind them to cloud applications. To create schemas and HDI containers, an SAP HANA database must be available in your space.

The "SAP HANA Schemas & HDI Containers" service works with SAP HANA databases provided by the SAP HANA service or SAP HANA Cloud.

service_offerings.name: objectstore
service_offerings.description: Highly available, distributed and eventually consistent objectstore.

metadata.longDescription: Provisions an object storage resource that can be used by cloud foundry applications to store & manage objects.

service_offerings.name: alert-notification
service_offerings.description: Service that exposes platform events and offers APIs for producing/consuming custom events

service_offerings.name: metering-service
service_offerings.description: Record usage data for commercial purposes like billing, charging, and resource planning.

service_offerings.name: data-intelligence
service_offerings.description: Orchestrate, refine, enrich, apply intelligence on your governed data across your entire distributed data landscape.

metadata.longDescription: SAP Data Intelligence is the all-in-one data orchestration solution to discover, refine, enriche and govern any type, variety, and volume of data across your entire distributed data landscape. Deliver on the promise of AI with enterprise scale, trust, and transparency driving significant new business value and insights.

service_offerings.name: one-mds
service_offerings.description: Service for master data integration

metadata.longDescription: SAP Master Data Integration offers master data synchronization across SAP solutions and is a central access layer for data sharing and distribution. SAP Master Data Integration can only be used for SAP to SAP Integration. It must not be directly accessed for 3rd party master data integration scenarios with SAP. SAP Master Data Orchestration is part of SAP Master Data Integration and can only be used in conjunction with SAP Master Data Integration.

service_offerings.name: cis
service_offerings.description: Manage the control plane, account model, and product resources in SAP BTP using supported API interfaces.

service_offerings.name: xfs-runtime
service_offerings.description: Build, run, and manage your cloud extensions in a fully-managed environment

metadata.longDescription: Build, run, and manage your cloud extensions in a fully-managed environment

service_offerings.name: service-manager
service_offerings.description: The central registry for service brokers and platforms in SAP Business Technology Platform

metadata.longDescription: SAP Service Manager allows you to consume platform services in any connected runtime environment, track service instances creation, and share services and service instances between different environments.

service_offerings.name: postgresql-db
service_offerings.description: PostgreSQL service on SAP BTP

service_offerings.name: redis-cache
service_offerings.description: Redis Cache service on SAP BTP

service_offerings.name: dynatrace
service_offerings.description: Create a Dynatrace environment and monitor your cloud applications and services.

metadata.longDescription: The Dynatrace Monitoring Service lets you create and configure your own Dynatrace environment and allows you to collect and analyze monitoring data of bound applications and services. This includes metrics, events, exceptions, and end-to-end traces. Supported by artificial intelligence with predictive capabilities, Dynatrace Monitoring Service offers you root-cause and dependency analysis so you can proactively observe and improve your applications performance.

service_offerings.name: cloud-logging
service_offerings.description: Store and analyze application logs, metrics, and traces based on OpenSearch.

metadata.longDescription: SAP Cloud Logging service is an instance-based observability service that builds upon OpenSearch to store, visualize, and analyze application logs, metrics, and traces from SAP BTP Cloud Foundry, Kyma, Kubernetes and other runtime environments. For Cloud Foundry and Kyma it offers an easy integration by providing predefined contents to investigate load, latency, and error rates of the observed applications based on their requests and correlate them with additional data.

service_offerings.name: content-agent
service_offerings.description: Content Agent allows you to assemble the content into MTAR and export it to the transport queue.

metadata.longDescription: Cloud Foundry based utility service that like an agent for content assembly and export to Transport Management Service or Change Management System

service_offerings.name: one-inbox-service
service_offerings.description: Integrate all tasks into a central solution.

metadata.longDescription: Note: The SAP Task Center service only enables, but does not include the integration implementation from the supported SAP solutions. The SAP Task Center service enables integration with SAP applications to provide a single entry point for end users to access all their assigned workflow tasks. The tasks can be accessed by end users through the SAP Task Center Web application.

service_offerings.description: Cloud Identity Services

metadata.longDescription: Cloud Identity Services provide basic capabilities for user authentication.

metadata.name: ADS
metadata.displayName: SAP Forms Service by Adobe: ADS

service_offerings.name: process-automation-service
service_offerings.description: Automate processes and tasks without requiring any coding skills

metadata.longDescription: SAP Build Process Automation is a citizen development solution to adapt, improve, and innovate business processes with the low-code/no-code capabilities of SAP Workflow Management and SAP Intelligent RPA.

service_offerings.name: poc-broker-test
service_offerings.description: Provides an overview of any service instances and bindings that have been created by a platform.

service_offerings.name: jobscheduler-d070025
service_offerings.description: Define and manage your jobs or Cloud Foundry tasks that run on one-time or recurring schedules.

metadata.longDescription: The Job Scheduling Service allows you to define and manage jobs that run once or on recurring schedules. Use this runtime-agnostic service to schedule REST endpoint actions in your application or to schedule long-running processes using Cloud Foundry tasks. Use REST APIs to schedule your jobs, including long-running jobs asynchronously, and create multiple schedule formats for both simple and complex recurring schedules. The Job Scheduling Service dashboard is a web interface that lets you manage jobs and schedules.
